CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1951, pg. 9, reads: "FETE DEPARTING COURIERITES - When Mrs. Tora Brooks Thompson, cashier for thirteen years in Courier's collection department, and Mrs. Edna Chappell Jackson, reporter for the past ten years... resigned their positions last Friday in order to raise their own families, fellow Courier employes [employees] and members of management, including Mrs. Robert L. Vann, president and publisher, and Mrs. Daisy Lampkin, vice president, tendered them a farewell party. They received an electric toaster and a table model radio as gifts, respectively. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men lined up at buffet table, including Jessie Vann in center, for going away reception of Tora Brooks and Edna Chappell, in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper offices
